intro: Scorzonera charadzae, commonly known as the Karakachan scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Scorzonera charadzae is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine. Its conservation status remains vulnerable due to habitat loss and over-collection.
